slides.title: Welcome to Statistics
slides.content:
# Introduction to Statistics and Probability

Welcome to **Statistics** - making sense of data!

## What You Will Learn:
- **Descriptive Statistics** - Summarizing data
- **Probability** - Chance and randomness
- **Distributions** - Patterns in data
- **Inference** - Drawing conclusions

> **Fun Fact:** Modern statistics began with analyzing games of chance in the 1600s!

slides.title: Measures of Center
slides.content:
# Measures of Center

## Mean (Average):
```
x-bar = Sum(x_i) / n
```

## Median:
Middle value when sorted.
- Odd n: Middle number
- Even n: Average of two middle

## Mode:
Most frequent value.

## Comparison:
| Measure | Best When |
|---------|----------|
| Mean | Symmetric data |
| Median | Skewed data |
| Mode | Categorical data |

slides.title: Measures of Spread
slides.content:
# Measures of Spread

## Range:
```
Range = Maximum - Minimum
```

## Variance:
```
s^2 = Sum((x_i - x-bar)^2) / (n-1)
```

## Standard Deviation:
```
s = sqrt(variance)
```

## Interquartile Range (IQR):
```
IQR = Q3 - Q1
```

## Five-Number Summary:
- Minimum, Q1, Median, Q3, Maximum

slides.title: Basic Probability
slides.content:
# Basic Probability

## Definition:
```
P(A) = (Favorable outcomes) / (Total outcomes)
```

## Properties:
- 0 <= P(A) <= 1
- P(certain) = 1
- P(impossible) = 0

## Complement:
```
P(not A) = 1 - P(A)
```

## Example:
Rolling a die:
- P(3) = 1/6
- P(even) = 3/6 = 1/2
- P(less than 5) = 4/6 = 2/3

slides.title: Probability Rules
slides.content:
# Probability Rules

## Addition Rule:
```
P(A or B) = P(A) + P(B) - P(A and B)
```

## Mutually Exclusive:
If A and B cannot both occur:
```
P(A or B) = P(A) + P(B)
```

## Multiplication Rule:
```
P(A and B) = P(A) x P(B|A)
```

## Independent Events:
If A doesn't affect B:
```
P(A and B) = P(A) x P(B)
```

## Conditional Probability:
```
P(A|B) = P(A and B) / P(B)
```

slides.title: Counting Principles
slides.content:
# Counting Principles

## Fundamental Counting:
If task A has m ways and task B has n ways:
```
Total ways = m x n
```

## Permutations (order matters):
```
nPr = n! / (n-r)!
```

## Combinations (order doesn't matter):
```
nCr = n! / (r! x (n-r)!)
```

## Factorial:
```
n! = n x (n-1) x (n-2) x ... x 1
```

## Example:
- Arrange 5 people in line: 5! = 120
- Choose 3 from 10: 10C3 = 120

slides.title: Random Variables
slides.content:
# Random Variables

## Definition:
Variable whose value is determined by chance.

## Types:
- Discrete: Countable values
- Continuous: Any value in interval

## Expected Value:
```
E(X) = Sum(x_i x P(x_i))
```

## Variance:
```
Var(X) = E(X^2) - [E(X)]^2
```

## Example:
Die roll:
```
E(X) = (1+2+3+4+5+6)/6 = 3.5
```

slides.title: Binomial Distribution
slides.content:
# Binomial Distribution

## Requirements:
- Fixed number of trials (n)
- Two outcomes (success/failure)
- Constant probability (p)
- Independent trials

## Formula:
```
P(X = k) = nCk x p^k x (1-p)^(n-k)
```

## Parameters:
- Mean: mu = np
- Standard Deviation: sigma = sqrt(np(1-p))

## Example:
Flip 10 coins, P(exactly 6 heads):
```
10C6 x (0.5)^6 x (0.5)^4 = 0.205
```

slides.title: Normal Distribution
slides.content:
# Normal Distribution

## Properties:
- Bell-shaped curve
- Symmetric about mean
- Mean = Median = Mode

## Parameters:
- mu (mean): Center
- sigma (standard deviation): Spread

## Standard Normal:
- mu = 0, sigma = 1
- Z-score: z = (x - mu) / sigma

## Empirical Rule:
- 68% within 1 sigma
- 95% within 2 sigma
- 99.7% within 3 sigma

slides.title: Sampling Distributions
slides.content:
# Sampling Distributions

## Sample Mean Distribution:
- Mean of sampling distribution = mu
- Standard Error: SE = sigma / sqrt(n)

## Central Limit Theorem:
For large n (>30), sample means are normally distributed, regardless of population shape.

## Implications:
- Larger n -> Smaller spread
- Can use normal methods

## Confidence Interval:
```
x-bar +/- z* x (s / sqrt(n))
```

slides.title: Hypothesis Testing
slides.content:
# Hypothesis Testing

## Steps:
1. State H0 (null) and Ha (alternative)
2. Choose significance level (alpha)
3. Calculate test statistic
4. Find p-value
5. Compare and conclude

## Hypotheses:
- H0: No effect/difference
- Ha: There is an effect

## Decision:
- p < alpha: Reject H0
- p >= alpha: Fail to reject H0

## Type I Error: Reject true H0
## Type II Error: Fail to reject false H0

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Statistics Summary

## Descriptive:
| Measure | Center | Spread |
|---------|--------|--------|
| Common | Mean | Std Dev |
| Robust | Median | IQR |

## Probability:
- P(A or B) = P(A) + P(B) - P(A and B)
- P(A and B) = P(A) x P(B) if independent

## Distributions:
- Binomial: Discrete, success/failure
- Normal: Continuous, bell curve

## Inference:
- Confidence intervals
- Hypothesis tests

> **Congratulations!** You've completed Statistics!
